Key Match Events: Colombia lost 1-0 to Bolivia despite playing a large chunk of the match with an extra man after Hector Cuellar was sent off after 20 minutes.
Pre-Game Insights: Diego Maradona refused to use the high altitude in La Paz as an excuse for his team's poor performance in 2009.
Bolivia's national team has been unbeatable at the Estadio Municipal de El Alto, winning two matches from two.
Post-Match Reflections: Oscar Villegas, the Bolivia coach, stated that they are trying to take care of details that can allow them to be more effective.
Marco Etcheverry, a former Bolivia great, suggested that the decision to play in El Alto is more to pacify the fans rather than a strategic advantage.
Miscellaneous Highlights: At 4,150 metres above sea level, the new home of the Bolivian national team in El Alto is about as challenging as it gets when it comes to playing at altitude.
Venezuela lost 4-0 to Bolivia in a World Cup qualifier in September.
Bolivia's impressive 2-1 win away to Chile in September was only their second competitive victory outside of the country in the past 28 years.
